title: 114_hr6303
content: POST OFFICE DESIGNATIONS. The United States Postal Service facility in Santa Barbara, California, is named the "Special Warfare Operator Master Chief Petty Officer (SEAL) Louis 'Lou' J. Langlais Post Office Building." Any reference to this facility shall now be to the designated name. Another facility in Shelby, Indiana, is named the "Richard Allen Cable Post Office." The United States Postal Service facility at 23323 Shelby Road in Shelby, Indiana, is designated as the "Richard Allen Cable Post Office." Similarly, the facility at 3031 Veterans Road West in Staten Island, New York, is named the "Leonard Montalto Post Office Building." Any references to these facilities in official records will reflect their new names. The United States Postal Service facility at 401 McElroy Drive in Oxford, Mississippi, is designated as the "Army First Lieutenant Donald C. Carwile Post Office Building." Any references to this facility in official records will now be to the "Army First Lieutenant Donald C. Carwile Post Office Building." The facility at 14231 TX-150 in Coldspring, Texas, is named the "E. Marie Youngblood Post Office." The United States Postal Service facility at 810 N. U.S. Highway 83 in Zapata, Texas, is designated as the "Zapata Veterans Post Office." Any references to this facility in official records will now be to the "Zapata Veterans Post Office." The United States Postal Service facility at 2886 Sandy Plains Road in Marietta, Georgia, is designated as the "Marine Lance Corporal Squire 'Skip' Wells Post Office Building." Any references to this facility in official records will now be to the "Marine Lance Corporal Squire 'Skip' Wells Post Office Building." The facility at 6300 N. Northwest Highway in Chicago, Illinois, is designated as the "Officer Joseph P. Cali Post Office Building." The United States Postal Service facility in Saipan, Northern Mariana Islands, is designated as the "Segundo T. Sablan and CNMI Fallen Military Heroes Post Office Building." Any references to this facility in official records will now be to the "Segundo T. Sablan and CNMI Fallen Military Heroes Post Office Building." The United States Postal Service facility at 1101 Davis Street in Evanston, Illinois, is now named the "Abner J. Mikva Post Office Building." Any mentions of this facility in official documents will now refer to the "Abner J. Mikva Post Office Building." The United States Postal Service will establish new ZIP codes for specific communities by September 30, 2017, including Miami Lakes, Florida, Storey County, Nevada, Flanders, Northampton, and Riverside in the Town of Southampton, New York, Ocoee, Florida, and Glendale, New York.
